title: Sachin Tendulkar

coverImage.license: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported license.

summary: Sachin Tendulkar is a former Indian international cricketer, regarded as one of the greatest batsmen of all time. He is the highest run scorer of all time in International cricket.

value.label: Sachin Ramesh Tendulkar
Mumbai, India
5 ft 5 in (165 cm)
God of cricket
Indian
Batsman
Considered the most wholesome batsman of his time, Sachin Tendulkar can also bowl medium pace, leg spin, and off spin.

image.altText: Style of play for Sachin Tendulkar
image.license: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution 2.0 Generic license.

value.label: In 1988, aged 15 years and 232 days, Tendulkar made his first class debut for Bombay against Gujarat and scored 100 not out in that match.
Tendulkar made his Test debut against Pakistan in Karachi in November 1989 aged 16 years.

The Pakistan Men's National Cricket Team, popularly referred to as the Shaheens, Green Shirts and Men in Green, is administered by the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB). The team is a Full Member of the International Cricket Council, and participates in Test, ODI and Twenty20 International cricket matches.

image.altText: Image of Pakistan national cricket team

value.label: Tendulkar was part of the Indian squad for the 1992 Cricket World Cup.
Tendulkar was the leading run scorer at the 1996 World Cup, with a total of 523 runs.

The 1996 Cricket World Cup, also called the Wills World Cup 1996 after its official sponsors, ITC's Wills brand, was the sixth Cricket World Cup. It was the second World Cup to be hosted by Pakistan and India, and for the first time by Sri Lanka.

Sachin's father died in the middle of the 1999 Cricket World Cup. HE flew back to India to attend the final rituals of his father, missing the match against Zimbabwe. However, he returned to the World Cup scoring a century (140 not out off 101 balls) in his very next match against Kenya in Bristol

The 1999 Cricket World Cup was the seventh edition of the Cricket World Cup, organised by the International Cricket Council (ICC). It was hosted primarily by England, with some games being played in Scotland, Ireland, Wales and the Netherlands.
Tendulkar made 673 runs in 11 matches in the 2003 Cricket World Cup
The 2003 Cricket World Cup was the eighth Cricket World Cup, organized by the International Cricket Council (ICC). It was co-hosted by South Africa, Zimbabwe and Kenya.
Tendulkar was made the icon player and captain for his home side, the Mumbai Indians in the inaugural Indian Premier League in 2008.

The Mumbai Indians are a franchise cricket team based in the city of Mumbai, Maharashtra. Founded in 2008, Mumbai Indians play in the Indian Premier League (IPL). The team is owned by India's biggest conglomerate, Reliance Industries.
With 664 runs, held the world record of highest unbroken partnership in any form of cricket with Vinod Kambli

image.altText: With 664 runs, held the world record of highest unbroken partnership in any form of cricket with Vinod Kambli

value.label: Youngest player to debut for India in both ODI and Test matches

image.altText: Youngest player to debut for India in both ODI and Test matches

value.label: Only player to score a century on debut in all three domestic first-class tournaments - Ranji, Irani, and Duleep Trophies.

image.altText: Only player to score a century on debut in all three domestic first-class tournaments - Ranji, Irani, and Duleep Trophies.

value.label: First batsman to complete 10,000 ODI runs

image.altText: First batsman to complete 10,000 ODI runs

value.label: At the age of 19, Tendulkar became the first ever overseas-born player to represent Yorkshire.

image.altText: At the age of 19, Tendulkar became the first ever overseas-born player to represent Yorkshire.

value.label: The India national cricket team is also known as Team India and Men in Blue. India is ranked first in Tests, second in ODIs and second in T20Is by the ICC. Virat Kohli is the current captain of the team, while the head coach is Ravi Shastri.

image.altText: Picture of India national cricket team

value.label: The Mumbai Indians are a franchise cricket team based in the city of Mumbai, Maharashtra. Founded in 2008, Mumbai Indians play in the Indian Premier League (IPL). The team is owned by India's biggest conglomerate, Reliance Industries.
Domestic Ranji trophy cricket team based in Mumbai
